description: Single storey side/rear extension (following partial demolition of existing side/rear addition); conversion of front garage into habitable room including insertion of a window in lieu of the garage door opening; installation of one rooflight to front roof slope and removal of chimney stack to main rear roof slope; alteration to external elevations
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s): SB22/IP/002 00 Location Plan, SB22/PC/002 02 Block Plans, SB22/PC/003 01 Existing Plans, SB22/PC/004 01 Existing Section, SB22/PC/005 01 Existing Elevations, SB22/PC/006 01 Existing Elevations, SB22/PC/007 02 Proposed Plans, SB22/PC/008 02 Roof Plans, SB22/PC/009 02 Proposed Section, SB22/PC/010 02 Proposed Elevations, SB22/PC/011 02 Proposed Side Elevations
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).
Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with

Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), Policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012).
| No part of the flat roof of the dwelling shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7A, Local Variation 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1(g), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policy D3 London Plan (2021).
